The hours I have in this game are more of a relic from another time. CS:GO is a much lonelier feeling place than it used to be. In the past, there was a very different vibe throughout the community. People weren't exactly friendlier, the game has always had some problems with toxicity, but there was a certain comradery that I honestly haven't felt from this game in years.

It's coming from several small and large changes over the years, but I think it's also a sign of the times. Other games I enjoyed years ago for the similarly enjoyable communities, have also slowly died out. No one wants to talk to each other anymore, not unless you're already in their Discord. And that makes it much more difficult to connect with people than it used to be. 

This isn't related to any of the actual parts of the game. It's a good game. But the talkative community was part of what made it great. And that's not there anymore. 

Anyways, vote Bernie 2012
